Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with an angular shoulder, decorated on the discus with Harpokrates leaning on a pillar, wearing a hemhemet crown and holding a cornucopia or lotus; beside him is a thymiaterion. At the rear is an Egyptian ring handle. The lamp stands on base-ring. The nozzle is broken. Covered with an orange-red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2038)
